intro: Talauma gitingensis var. glabra, commonly known as the smooth talauma, is a species of flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its smooth, glabrous leaves. The plant typically grows in lowland forest areas and thrives in humid, tropical climates. Its flowers are small and clustered, often greenish-yellow in color, and it produces a milky sap that is characteristic of the Euphorbiaceae family. This variety is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and potential ecological roles in its native habitat.
